Authors:
Chanokned Senwanana, Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Mingkhuan Doilom,
Kevin D Hyde, Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon
Title:
Novel taxa of Diatrypaceae from Para rubber (Hevea
brasiliensis) in northern Thailand; introducing a novel genus
Allocryptovalsa
Keywords:
Phylogeny, Sordariomycetes, taxonomy, unitunicate fungi,
Xylariales
Abstract:
Species of Diatrypaceae are widespread on dead wood of
plants worldwide. The delineation of this family is rather problematic
because the characters of ascostromata are extremely variable and the
names of taxa with sequence data are often misleading. In this paper,
species of Diatrypaceae were collected from Para rubber in northern
Thailand for examination and illustrations. Based on morphological
characteristics and phylogenetic analyses, a new genus, Allocryptovalsa,
is introduced to accommodate a new species A. polyspora and two species,
A. cryptovalsoidea and A. rabenhorstii are transferred to the new genus.
The new species, Diatrypella heveae and Peroneutypa longiasca are also
introduced in this paper. Phylogenetic analyses of combined ITS and
Î²-tubulin sequence data show their phylogenetic affinities in
Diatrypaceae. Our study also shows that phylogenetic analyses of taxa of
Diatrypaceae are highly confused as some genera are shown to be
polyphyletic.
